metadata.title: CVE-2020-17482 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue has been found in PowerDNS Authoritative Server before 4.3.1 wherean authorized user with the ability to insert crafted records into a zonemight be able to leak the content of uninitialized memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-17482` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-geoip - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
pdns-backend-lua - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
pdns-backend-mydns - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
pdns-server - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
pdns-tools - 4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pdns package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.0~alpha2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1').
